block.p: Bethany Aryn Davis and David Luther Noll, partners in an Internet consulting company in New York, were married yesterday. The bride's father, Charles Davis, an interdenominational minister, performed the ceremony at River Glen Presbyterian Church in Naperville, Ill.
The bride and the bridegroom, both 22, are partners in Public Digital, which provides consulting services to nonprofit agencies.

Bethany Aryn Davis and David Luther Noll, partners in an Internet consulting company in New York, were married yesterday. The bride's father, Charles Davis, an interdenominational minister, performed the ceremony at River Glen Presbyterian Church in Naperville, Ill.
The bride and the bridegroom, both 22, are partners in Public Digital, which provides consulting services to nonprofit agencies.

The bride graduated magna cum laude from Barnard College. Her father and her mother, Kristina Davis, live in Winfield, Ill. The bride's father is the director of the Evangelical Alliance Mission in Wheaton, Ill.; her mother is a graphic designer in the mission's communications department.

Mr. Noll's parents, Ruth and Mark Noll, live in Wheaton. The bridegroom's mother is a research librarian at Wheaton College, where his father, a professor of history, holds the McManis chair of Christian thought. He is also a co-founder and the director of the Institute for the Study of American Evangelicalism.
